content.description: Stand start on the left facing flake just right of the small boulder at the base of the face. Move up and get the obvious pocket with the right hand. Make a big move with the left hand to the small finger slot below the lip. Get the lip with the right hand, and perform an awkward mantle to top out. An awesome problem!
content.location: The route is on the overhanging east face of the Minute Man Boulder, facing the drainage and the road.

content.description:
Absolutely perfect rock and interesting movement make this climb worth doing if you're in the area.

Climb the black, swirly face starting with your left hand on a flake at 6 feet and your right hand in a slopey pocket at 5 feet. Make a tricky move to stick the slopey slot above and then top out slightly left and up on slopers and crimps.

There is potential for a hard sit start to this problem, but it probably would not climb as well.
content.protection: A couple of pads should suffice. Watch the rock in the landing zone.
content.location: This problem is located on a boulder about 15 yards downhill and left of Minute Man.
